Description: Small blue glazed composition juglet; ovoid body on a raised disc base; narrow neck with a flaring mouth; single vertical handle from shoulder to base of mouth; repaired from fragments and surface very worn.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 118, Tomb 51; p. 114 & fig. 166, no. 3)
SCE IV/2 / The Swedish Cyprus Expedition. Vol. IV. Part 2. The Cypro-Geometric, Cypro-Archaic and Cypro-Classical periods. (p. 174 & fig. 38, no. 37)
